felix_room1.description: Milo's starting to get into sorting and container play, such as Felix was into at age 7 months.
felix_room1.title: Felix Room 1

felix_room2.description: Felix is a great big brother.  Never bitter, always sweet.
felix_room2.title: Felix Room 2

jordan.description: Nanny Maria has been keeping Jordan along with Milo for about a month. We've learned that Milo is very good at sharing. He is not one bit possessive about his toys, snacks or nanny.
jordan.title: Jordan

pizza.description: Baking pizza.  Felix actually helps.  Milo insists on an apron just like Felix's.
pizza.title: Pizza

san_mateo1.description: San Mateo's Central Park has the smallest passenger train ever.
san_mateo1.title: San Mateo 1

san_mateo2.description: The park also has a Japanese tea garden.... what's everyone looking at?
san_mateo2.title: San Mateo 2

san_mateo4.description: Nothing like a tea garden to bring out the poet-philospher in all of us.
san_mateo4.title: San Mateo 4

san_mateo5.description: Peekaboo, I spy the honored spirits of your ancestors!
san_mateo5.title: San Mateo 5

shy.description:
We think of Milo as a bungie-jumping extrovert. But he surprises us with moments where he crumbles like an oatmeal cookie. Just this week he:
  • Refused to get into the San Mateo park train.
  • Refused to let Lucie take him into the water until the very end of his first swim class.
  • Refused to un-embed himself from Lucie's lap at music class.
He confines his fears to things that happen to be completely safe. God forbid he'd think twice about running out into a busy street.
shy.title: Shy

tv.description: Milo demands Teletubbies with the same intonation as Henry VIII ordering his jesters to amuse.
tv.title: Tv

description:
Felix is bringing home from school more than artwork and runny noses. He's getting opinions from people other than Dean and Lucie! It was bound to happen, but it was nevertheless suprising the first time he went on about cigarettes. And then about sugar. It was inevitable, and we don't disagree with these particular opinions though we could wish them to be more nuanced. Just... there was this unconscious assumption that we'd have 10, 20, 30 years to indoctrinate him to our particular world view. Poof.

Milo started pooping in the potty. Not every time, not even most of the time, but definitely at bath time. He's not concerned by near misses or misses of any kind, really. And we have something to say to whoever snuck in and taught him that the bathroom scale is an acceptable potty: NOT FUNNY.

Milo's words of the last two weeks:

  • Milo: Show him a picture of himself, and he says his name! He still can't say Felix, though.
  • pita: pizza. Cheese, sausage, onions -- it's all good.
  • cheepuff: cheesepuff. Stroller food.
  • chee: cream cheese or butter. For putting on bo.
  • bo: bagel. What you put chee on.
  • ouse: house. There certainly are a lot of them when you walk down the street.
  • wee: tree. Often found near ouses. When Dean says "big tree!" Milo responds "wow."

We went to a cocktail party and took pictures of some old friends.
title: January 22
